title: FC Ararat-Armenia
text:
FC Ararat-Armenia (), is an Armenian <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Yerevan">Yerevan</a>, founded in 2017.
History.
It was founded in 2017 as FC Avan Academy by <a href="Ruben%20Hayrapetyan">Ruben Hayrapetyan</a>, on the basis of the young players of the <a href="Yerevan%20Football%20Academy">Yerevan Football Academy</a> graduates, as well as many young players from <a href="FC%20Pyunik">FC Pyunik</a>.
They club's inaugural match took place in July 2017 against <a href="Erebuni%20SC">Erebuni SC</a>. The friendly match ended up with a score of 3–1 in favour of Avan Academy.
At the beginning of 2018, the club was taken over by the Russian-Armenian businessman <a href="Samvel%20Karapetyan%20%28businessman%29">Samvel Karapetyan</a> who renamed the football club as Ararat-Moskva, from <a href="Mount%20Ararat">Mount Ararat</a>. The club was reorganized as soon as <a href="FC%20Ararat%20Moscow">FC Ararat Moscow</a> in Russia was denied certificate for the next season. Artak Oseyan managed the club during the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20Armenian%20First%20League">2017–18 Armenian First League</a> season.
After being promoted to the Armenian Premier League, it was again renamed, this time to Ararat-Armenia, and will participate in the Premier League with this name.
On 2 August 2018, <a href="Vadim%20Skripchenko">Vadim Skripchenko</a> was appointed as the new head coach of Ararat-Armenia, before being sacked on 25 September 2018, and Ararat-Armenia-2 manager Artak Oseyan being appointed as caretaker manager.
On 1 October 2018, <a href="Vardan%20Minasyan">Vardan Minasyan</a> was appointed as the new head coach of Ararat-Armenia.
On 30 May 2019, Ararat-Armenia defeated <a href="FC%20Banants">Banants</a> 1–0 to win their first <a href="Armenian%20Premier%20League">Armenian Premier League</a> title. As a result of winning the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Armenian%20Premier%20League">2018–19 Armenian Premier League</a>, Ararat-Armenia qualified for the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20UEFA%20Champions%20League">UEFA Champions League</a>.
On 14 July 2020, Ararat-Armenia defended their Armenian Premier League title, securing their second league title, after defeating <a href="FC%20Noah">FC Noah</a> 2-0. Three days later, 17 July 2020, Manager <a href="Vardan%20Minasyan">Vardan Minasyan</a> left the club after his contract expired. On 22 July 2020, Ararat-Armenia announced David Campaña as their new manager. On 5 March 2021, David Campaña left his role as Head Coach by mutual consent, with <a href="Armen%20Adamyan">Armen Adamyan</a> being appointed as the Caretaker Head Coach. On 24 March 2021, Ararat-Armenia announced <a href="Anatoly%20Baidachny">Anatoly Baidachny</a> as their new Head Coach. Baidachny would leave Ararat-Armenia by mutual consent two and a half months later, on 8 June 20201, by mutual consent, having won just three of his twelve games in charge. On 14 June 2021, Ararat-Armenia announced that <a href="Dmitri%20Gunko">Dmitri Gunko</a> had been appointed as the clubs new Head Coach.
League and cup.
The second team of the club Ararat-Armenia-2 has been playing in the first league (2nd division) since the 2018–19 season.
Current squad.
Ararat-Armenia-2.
Ararat-Armenia's reserve squad play as Ararat-Armenia-2 in the <a href="Armenian%20First%20League">Armenian First League</a>. They currently play their home games at the <a href="Yerevan%20Football%20Academy%20Stadium">Yerevan Football Academy Stadium</a> in the <a href="Avan%20District">Avan District</a> of northern Yerevan.
